description: This function generates a series of unit squares within a rectangle, scaled down by a factor of 0.5. It is used for educational purposes to visualize the concept of area and the relationship between different units of measurement.

educational_standards.description: Measure areas by counting unit squares in square feet \((ft^{2})\).
Given the area and a side, find the missing side length.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Unit Squares within Rectangles
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function can draw a series of rectangles with unit squares inside them. It accepts a list of rectangle data, each with a specified width and length. The rectangles are drawn to scale, with the maximum dimensions of the rectangles in the list determining the scale factor. The function is useful for teaching concepts such as area, scale, and the relationship between different units of measurement.

details: data: A list of rectangle data, each with a specified width and length
Each rectangle data controls the dimensions of a rectangle to be drawn
Width and length of each rectangle must be positive integers
The number of rectangles (length of the data list) can be any positive integer
The scale factor is fixed at 0.5
The function draws a series of rectangles with unit squares inside them
Each rectangle is drawn to scale, with the maximum dimensions of the rectangles in the list determining the scale factor
The dimensions of the rectangles and the number of unit squares inside them are determined by the input data
